page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: South of the valley of the West Okehampton the land quickly gains height, rising to the high ground of northern Dartmoor. The lowest part of this area near Meldon is about 200m. above sea level, while Yes Tor stands at 619m., only 2m below Dartmoor's highest point, High Willhays. Most of the area is wilderness country, only the north-west edge being intruded upon by farming, quarrying and water catchment. The wild areas have a dual use as rough grazing and army ranges, Okehampton Camp being at the northern edge of the area. Much of the area is relatively inaccessible, with the road to Meldon Dam and the military loop road the only entry for vehicles. There is good walking as there are less bogs than some parts of the moor. Sometimes the area is closed by army firing.
